meanings.definition: A heavy, low-quality fuel oil used in power plants and industrial boilers.
meanings.sent1: The power plant ran on mazut to generate electricity.
meanings.sent2: The industrial boiler was fueled by mazut for efficient operation.
meanings.sent3: The power plant workers joked that mazut was the secret ingredient for their energy output.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fuels, mazut stood as the heavyweight champion.
meanings.sent5: The thick, dark mazut flowed through the pipes like a sluggish river of energy.

meanings.definition: To fuel or power with mazut.
meanings.sent1: They decided to mazut the generator to keep the lights on during the storm.
meanings.sent2: The ship was mazuted with the heavy oil before setting sail.
meanings.sent3: The chef jokingly threatened to mazut the kitchen appliances if they didn't work properly.
meanings.sent4: His determination mazuted his journey through the challenges he faced.
meanings.sent5: The engine roared to life as they mazuted it with the potent liquid fuel.
